meanings.definition: To absorb or integrate into a larger group or culture.
meanings.sent1: The new student quickly assimilates into the school community.
meanings.sent2: She assimilates new ideas easily during class discussions.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle piece assimilates into the picture perfectly.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude assimilates into the team dynamic, boosting morale.
meanings.sent5: The sponge assimilates water, growing heavier with each drop.

meanings.definition: To take in and incorporate as one's own.
meanings.sent1: He assimilates the advice from his mentor to improve his skills.
meanings.sent2: The artist assimilates different art styles into her own unique creations.
meanings.sent3: The robot assimilates the commands, becoming more efficient.
meanings.sent4: She assimilates the flavors of the dish, savoring each bite.
meanings.sent5: The plant assimilates sunlight to produce energy for growth.

meanings.definition: To cause to resemble; make similar.
meanings.sent1: The tailor assimilates the new design into the existing pattern.
meanings.sent2: The makeup artist assimilates the celebrity's look for the photoshoot.
meanings.sent3: The comedian assimilates the politician's speech, creating a hilarious parody.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style assimilates different approaches, creating a balanced team.
meanings.sent5: The chameleon assimilates the colors of its surroundings, blending in seamlessly.
